title: My parents are not supporting me to sing. What shall I do to learn singing? (Don't tell me to talk to my parents cause I've tried everything and they don't seem to change at all) - Quora

response.answer_text: Why do you need support? Why do you want to sing? If you think you are going to become a pop music star…. that’s a hard long road. I wouldn’t wish Miley Cyrus on anyone. If you want to sing for your own pleasure, get some books, you tube tutorials. save up money for singing lessons. The more you pursue your dream on your own, the more it will impress… or should impress your parents. Watch Rigoletto on movie night and say that’s what you want to achieve. Parents can be hard, but most of it is because their vision of your life sees a different picture, and singers… or anyone in the entertaining arts 1) rarely make it 2) have a lot of problems with drugs, divorce, and family drama. It doesn’t mean your parents are right, but their vision of your future is not aligning with your vision. So recognize why that is, work to address it.

I would recommend you to watch Youtube videos on singing exercises. It’s just the same as going to a vocal coach. It’s free and you can do it anytime! It'll help you improve on your singing a lot. It’s okay if your parents don’t agree with you on what you wanna do, it’s okay. Sometimes parents are just like that. Just give them time. If you keep doing it and show your parents that you LIKE singing and they see that you’re good doing it then maybe they might change their mind. I would say to just keep going towards your goal. Nothing can stay in your way! Hope this helped you :)!
